div.p: This one might be deleted from the M letter set, as strictly speaking it does not mention M. Without knowing the context it would not appear to be a Mentions letter. I have cross-referred to it at its Kew location, not the file in the edition
RBG Kew Directors' correspondence, vol 139, f. 61

As the season for transplanting trees is coming on please tell me if I can send you anything this autumn and if so, I should be glad to have your desideratus at once so as to keep and pick out the best for you.

Did the Todea appear? I looked in vain for it in Gardeners Chronicle or did you publish your article with cut in some other journal which I do not read.
Hookers article appeared in the Botanical Magazine, vol. 98, 1872, t. 5954. It included the statement 'still larger specimens than the above have been since sent to Europe by Baron von Mueller, of which one, presented by him to Mr. J Booth, of Flottbeck, Hamburgh, weighed one ton 3 cwt….'

The specimen is doing wonderful and almost worth coming over to have a look at it. About 130 fronds developed and the whole brown monster is covered with young fresh fleshy brown roots by thousands, so I dare say the plant is safe now.

I should like to send a photograph of it to Regel, Morren, &c for publishing in their journals, — but I hesitate in doing so before having seen the style of your article in which you mention how I came to the plant &c &c.
